snippet: Prominent secular opponents of President Mohamed Morsi gathered with the Egyptian leader’s Islamist allies on Thursday after days of political chaos threatening the transition to democracy.
abstract: Prominent secular opponents of Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi meet with members of Muslim Brotherhood after days of political chaos and street violence threaten transition to democracy.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Prominent secular opponents of President Mohamed Morsi gathered with the Egyptian leader’s Islamist allies on Thursday after days of political chaos threatening the transition to democracy.

headline.seo: Rivals in Egypt Hold Rare Meeting and Urge Dialogue
headline.main: Egypt Rivals Hold Rare Meeting and Call for Dialogue
headline.print_headline: Rivals Across Egypt’s Political Spectrum Hold Rare Meeting, Urging Dialogue

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
